alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 19 at 5:27PM EDT by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Rutland and southwestern Windsor Counties through 615 PM EDT... At 527 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Ludlow, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chester, Windsor, Mount Holly, Ludlow, Cavendish, Weston, Andover, Ludlow Village, Perkinsville Village, Mt. Holly, Ascutney, Baltimore, Springfield, Weathersfield, West Windsor, Reading, Plymouth, Wallingford, Mount Tabor and Perkinsville. This includes Interstate 91 between mile markers 40 and 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Windsor
